summary: The episodes starts with a long discussion about a leech experiment before Ricky starts having a go at karl over how much holiday he's having. The transcript ends after the first 15 mins.

transcript.content: The Magic Numbers - Forever Lost
Forever Lost - The Magic Numbers. And the magic number is 104.9. Xfm. I'm Ricky Gervais. With me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Right. Two more shows. Till we're off air for don't know how long.
Is that two more, including this one?
Yeah. No, no, no, this is one. And then there's another one.
Right two more shows...
There's two more shows, well start in now, if I said this at the end, it might have been ambiguous. I said at the beginning, there's 2 hours. That's a whole show. So there's two more shows.
So two more shows. Including this one.
Yes, obviously.
So one more show after this one.
It's only five past one.
One after this show. One more show.
Now there's only one more show. Good night. Now, it better be a good one Karl. Have we got uhh, Rockbusters?
Yep.
Check. Have we got Monkey News?
Check.
Is it a real monkey news or is it somewhat that's slightly made up.
Always is...
What?!
Always is once you check.
Okay, nob news?
We got a bit of nob news.

I'm worried that nob news, because it's only about penises, is a little bit sexist. Have we got any fanny facts? Could we Maybe - can we sort that out for next week? I don't want to alienate our female audience.
Welcome to Minge London. Good, I'm glad that's that, well, brilliant. We got a song with the story.
Yep
What is it?
I don't want to sort of tell you what it is yet, because the song isn't that great.
Oh good.
It's not a song that's like an Xfm song, but every time I hear it on, say, like, magic or whatever -
Yeah...
I have an argument...
Yeah. I have an argument with Suzanne that, know you, what I think it's about. And she says, "don't be stupid, it's not about that". And I say no, it is.
And so we're going to decide who's right. Well, I don't know what song you're talking about and I don't know what the argument is, but Suzanne's right.
Definitely.
No doubt about it.
We'll have a listen. But I'm hoping that once people sort of listen to it again with my thoughts....
Well, this song sums up what people should think of you. It's Don't Believe a Word. All right? That's the sort of links I'm capable of.
If that doesn't bag us a Sony then nothing will.
Thin Lizzy - Don't believe a word
Thin Lizzy - Don't Believe a Word on Xfm 104.9. I'm going to miss this show. It's been good.
You might be the only one.
No. Well, you know. So we'll come back again. We got a lot to do over the next few months, but maybe Christmas or just after. But I still call Karl every day anyway.
Oh, sure.
I called him a couple of days ago.
Course you did.

And I went uhh - it was the weekend - and I went, "what you doing?" and he went, "Uhh, just in Regents Park and that" I went "what you doing" he said "just going - Oh! Jesus!" I went "what?" he went "a caterpillar just fell out of the sky". I went "what!?" he went "A caterpillar just fell out of the sky. God, it's there. It's wriggling around" I went "sure a bird didn't just drop it?" he looked up and went "oh, yeah. There's a bird".
For a moment he thought caterpillars were raining from the sky.
I thought I was in chicken lickin'.
Yeah.
Unbelievable. Why did you think a caterpillars are falling out of the sky?
I don't know, it just startled me a bit.
I love Karl being startled!

I love the idea, he's straight on the phone to Trevor McDonald "Look, Trevor, there's this caterpillars, insects falling out the sky! They're pulling out the sky now! Put it on the news, quick!" "You sure that wasn't a bird?" "Oh, there was a bird, sorry Trev!"
"Bye!"
But it was after like a hung up the phone and that from you. I sort of sat there for a bit watching it.
I imagine him cross legged just in front of it. On the grass.
But do you know what? Because of his shape, the shape of his head and his sort of IQ, I bet the caterpillar was thinking: "Hmmm, Mama!"
Yeah
Do you know what I mean? Unbelievable!
Go on.
It was sort of running about all over the place, right, Steve? Caterpillars have loads of feet and that, don't they?
Wow. Well, they have six legs. They're actually in larva, not an insect and they have six legs.
But they have little sucker things to hold on to, cabbages and that.
No, they've got more than that.
No, I'm telling you. They have got six true legs. Trust me. Trust me, I'm a scientist.
And you were thinking what, Karl?
Well, they've got little pods.
They've got little pseudo-pod-, legs and little suckers, yeah.

But it was running about, like, everywhere. Right? Mental. But sort of running off to the left... And then it sort of went back to where it was... Then went right and what have you. I'm just thinking, whoever gave them the legs, right? What's the point, if they don't know where they're going and that?
Ricky giggles
D'ya know what I mean? If you can get-
Imagine that sentence! Did you hear that? Did you hear that sentence? Can we play that sentence back?
No, I don't think we can.
"Imagine who gave them that legs..."
"Whoever gave 'em them legs, what's the point if they don't know where they're going?"
"And that"! Always "and that"
"And that"

But maybe... Just to be fair to the caterpillar with all its legs, okay? It didn't know where it was going... It had just been plucked from its house by a bird, shot up into the sky and then dropped from 80ft. Hitting the ground.
Onto the head of a weird, bold, shaved monkey.
It was probably concussed!
Yeah
It's just one of them things again, though.
But it still knew more about the world than you! How does that make you feel?
I just think it's waste of time having all them feet.
Feet now! It's got feet now!
Feet, yeah
It's a nightmare buying him shoes, don't it, Karl?
What was it you were saying about leeches and that? Because we were talking about insects.
They're not insects.
What are they?
Well, I think they're probably... a class of- Probably platyhelminthes
Yeah
Probably sort of like a flat worm type of thing.
That's what you were thinking, wasn't it, Karl?
Yeah!
I'm not sure about that. I don't know what the family of them is, but no- that'd be... (mumbles)
What was the leech- What was an interesting leech fact?
Well there's an experiment where you get a maze for a leech and there's a bit of blood, and it learns- it eventually finds its way to the blood, okay? And then it knows
Okay
And if you put it back to where it starts, it knows where- It goes straight towards it because it's learnt it. If you liquidize that leech
Right
And feed it to some leeches who have never done the maze, because of a thing called chemical memory, they find their way straight to the blood.
That is extraordinary.
It's extraordinary.
Yeah.
I mean, it's incredible.
We should try that out at Hampton Court one weekend!
(laughs) Yeah
But maybe with some tourists. Just blend up some tourists.
Or the people on them-- I'll tell you, what would do it. Those people who go on Celebrity Love Island
Any of them
They would do anything to go. They would be liquidized. People have enemas. They will do anything-- They will wank off pigs. They will do anything to get on telly.
Yeah
What about that? Be liquidized and fed to another-- Get one 'D' celebrity slapper, liquidize her and feed her to another slut
So blend up Abi Titmuss
And see as if she can find her (laughs), and see if she can find her way to Channel Five. What a brilliant show! Hosted by Jimmy Carr.
Of course
That would be amazing!
Song fades in
The Kinks - 'Better Things' on XFM 104.9 Steve Merchant, Ricky Gervais, Karl Pilkington.
But do you know this... We're talking about the leech thing?
Sure.
You're saying put them in a blender?
I'm not saying that!
Well, someone did.
Yeah.
Why were they doing that in the first place? D'ya know what I mean? How did they find out that if you if you put leeches in the blender?
I don't know. They probably kept notes, I don't-- I don't--
No no no, but what made them-- Were they just having a laugh? What-- what made them go...
Yeah, it was at a party. A couple of 14 year olds at a party.

No, it was a couple of research scientists. They'd be given a million pounds and the boss was coming around to say "What you're doing?" And they were just making a smoothie and they went: "Quick, Mr. Yakamoto is coming round! Show him some leeches!" "What are you doing?" "Just leechin'"
"Just feeding these leeches to some other leeches." "All right, well, that looks like science, I'm off!"
"Here's another million pounds for next year, bye!"
Yeah, yeah
That's how they work though, innit?
Yeah. That's exactly how they work!
A lot of the scientists-- I'm just saying they're getting away with murder.
Go on.
Well, just just the way they do, sort of spend their time.

And you can't say anything in front of him, because everything's got to have a point with him. You can't have a conversation with Karl, because he always puts in a curveball. You tell him something and the question comes back that you never could have expected. When I told him that story about the monkey who'd run away because he had an argument with his father, he said, "What was it about?"
(laughs) Yeah
Now, no one in the world thinks that! No one in the world would ask that question.
The leech thing, you know how you said, "show the leech the way to that food, whatever it's eating, whatever" in the maze, right?
Yeah.
It makes its way. It eats the cheese or whatever.
Blood!
Blood, right?
(laughing) "Cheese!"
Everything's a cartoon with Karl as well, innit?
Yeah
Everything is a cartoon!
There's a leech with a little hat and a little Babybel at one end.
But what happens if you got another one and move the bit of blood, right?
Yeah
So feed those two leeches to one, then what? Is it going to get confused or...? Do you know what I mean? Which way will it go if it's eating two? Two leeches?
Yeah
That have done two different ways... Is it sort of stressed out?

(laughs) I don't know! I don't know. It probably knows both routes. It probably goes "Well, there's one over here!" (mimicks eating sound) "Oh, it's one over here as well!" (mimicks eating sound) "I'm happy, I've had two for the price of one! And I'm full of leeches"
What's the best that can happen for like--
I don't kn-- What are you talking about?! What do you want out of me?!
Because I'm just saying if by that-- If by doing that, they can go "Right, we can do this with humans"
OHH! WHAT DO YOU MEAN?! What do you-- What. Do. You. Mean?! In the name of Christ? What do you mean?
They can't do it with humans!
All I'm saying is, what's the point in doing it?
Think! What do you mean?!
If you could do it with humans, I'd say...
But what-- what-- wha--
Right, Karl, think about what you're saying, man!
Yeah. I'm saying
"If you could do it with humans"! Do what with humans?
Say, if Einstein, right? Didn't do all that maths that he did, right? Say if he got to 'E=' and then he died
Right
Squash his brain, give it to someone else, say "Right, eat that!" And they go "Right. 'E=MC2' innit? What I'm saying is
But they wouldn't!
They'd go 'E= hmmm' wouldn't they? If it was chemical memory, they'd go "Oh 'E= Hmmm, yeah same as Einstein said. Yeah, I just ate his brain.'

What am I saying?! What have you made-- Karl! Think what you're saying! It's unbelievable! The thing is, right, actually, you are what a scientist does, you just keep saying 'why' and 'what' and 'why' and 'what', but nothing's ever enough for you! Which is good, it's nice to have a insatiable

I just- I get annoyed with all the amount of time and effort that's put into stuff that's useless. What's the next stage to squashing that leech? If it's not going anywhere, forget it! Work on something else. It's the same way in some science magazine I was reading about, 'Is there anything smaller than the quantum electron or something?'
Yeah
It's like, if it's not getting in the way, don't worry about it! Why are they worrying about things we can't see?
If you blended up Karl's brain and fed it to someone, would it make any difference? They wouldn't even notice, would they?
No, they wouldn't have.
They feed it to a leech and they go "Ah I don't know what I was doing"
"What was I doing? Was I--?"
And leave them more confused.
I don't know. Talking to leeches: Did you see the dregs that they put into Big Brother last night?
I not been watching it.
It's bad enough anyway. It's a house full of people you wouldn't cross the road... to save, right?
Yeah, yeah
But they've put in three more, to spice up a little bit. They've put in a low esteemed model, right?
Sure.
They've put in Mr. Bean, who is the whitest man I've ever seen. I mean, it's like a new race, he's nearly see-through and this thing that looks like Matt Lucas in a bikini.
Wow!
Unbelievable. The fat things on her back... I thought she was coming towards me!
Really?
It was unbelievable. And the first thing she said, she went in, she looked in the mirror, adjusted herself and went "Oh, me minge!"
That's the level... it's--
Do these people have relatives? Is there anyone in the world who knows them? Claims to be a friend of theirs...
Family.
Do they have family though, or the family they just moved away?

No no no, their family their family are probably quite proud of them. Because they're on the telly. It's probably like "Saw your daughter last night saying 'Oh me minge' on the telly." "Yes, she was on the telly, wasn't she?" "Yes, she was on the telly."
What about the bit about 'Oh me minge'? She got one out immediately, got it out. Lobbed it out-- It's-- I mean, it's unbelievable. It looks like an experiment.

I can't watch it anymore. It's just too much now, because I can't relate to those people. In the first series, I always remember it seemed like a genuine social experiment. There was intrigue, there was drama. It was genuinely great, hypnotic television.
Now it's like putting ants in a jar and shaking it.
Yeah. I don't know-- but even that, I couldn't watch that once a night every week.
No, I know.
It's just... unspeakable

It is unbelievable what people are willing to do now-- Because they just put in people... I mean it's unbelievable. It really is. You don't care about anyone. But I suppose what's good is that you watch it now, because you want one of them to fall over and hurt themselves (laughs)
Yeah. Or just choke on a chicken bone. And no one else in the house knows the Heimlich maneuver.
That's a good idea, isn't it?
Yeah, feed them more chicken. Send them more roast chicken. So we got a wonderful celebration for.
Song fades in
'Pushing the Senses' by Feeder on XFM. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Alright? How are you doing, Karl?
Yeah, I'm alright, yeah.
Another holiday?
Well, it wasn't a holiday.
It was. You had five days off work. Why is that not a holiday? You had five days not working for a living. You know how many days holiday he gets a year now? 29!
Ahh! That's more than teachers, isn't it?
It makes me sick. It makes. Me. sick.
Well, I know, the kind of hours you work, Rick... It's mad! I mean, if you're not in work by midday, you're furious!
Ricky giggles
No, but I mean, I'm always...
29 is normal. For the normal working person.
Yeah, but, you know...
Anyway, it wasn't a proper holiday. I went to see my mum and dad. It's nice to see him and everything, but it's not a holiday, is it?
Why?
It's not going away? It's not getting on the plane, is it? Going away?
Oh is that the definition of a holiday? What happened before 1950?
Hmmmm I don't know
Yeah, exactly. People used to go to Blackpool or Brighton. That was a holiday. Where did you go?
Into Wales.
There you go. A lovely holiday. A lovely holiday, have a holiday in wales. That's what they say, init?
Come to Wales, have a holiday! That's what they say, innit? They don't say "Come to Wales and meet your parents"! They say "Come to Wales and have a lovely holiday"!
Well, anyway, it was good and that. It's always good to see them
Well yeah. A week off work.
Do you know how mom likes gnomes and stuff?
Yeah, right.
Of course she does! She's lived with one for 30 years! (giggles)
She said... "Get your dad to take us to this to this park where they've got like, six foot gnomes and stuff... have a walk about"
Sounds like a nightmare! It's like a living night there.
"Keep an eye on Karl!"
Yeah
He stood still for two minutes. Someone bought him.

No no no, you can't buy them and that. It's like a little exhibition thing and it's part of a hall, this big hall that you have to pay to get in. But we didn't want to see the hall, we just want to see the gnomes.
Of course you did, yeah.
Anyway, my dad says, "yeah, well, we can get in there for free"
Of course he did.
Clever.
So we parked up on this little country lane, right? No one about
(laughs) How much was it to go in? Like like two quid?
Like three quid each.
Yeah
But you said-- Yeah but if you don't have to pay... I mean, you enjoy it even more, don't you? When you're walking about, you think "I've got this three quid in my pocket, no one's having it", right?
No, you're looking over your shoulder for a bloke with a peaked hat saying "Can I see your ticket, please?" I wouldn't enjoy it more.
No, you don't worry about it.
You got a bit of money now then, Rick! You're changed!
Anyway, we had to walk across about four fields.
Ricky laughs
For three quid!

And what happened was... we're walking through all these fields and what have you, big grass and muddy bits and all that, it's been raining and climbing over fences and stuff... And we're in this field, right? And I looked to me right, and there's about 30 cows all staring at us. Right? And Suzanne started to panic a bit. She said, we shouldn't be here. Dad says "Of course we can! We're allowed to go wherever we want. You know, all this land, it's ramblers rights" and all that stuff.
Yeah. You can take a camera if you want. Unattended.
Karl laughs
Serves him right for leaving him in the field unattended.
(mumbles)... for a week!
Anyway, these cows start surrounding us
(laughing) "Surrounding us!" Oh brilliant! Face off!
And Suzanne's panicking, going "This isn't right. We're not going to make it to the fence in time!" They're moving in fast on us and they started sort of running a bit.
Wow! It was a bovine West Side Story! A gang of cows coming at you.
My dad was like "Don't worry about it" and stuff, but me dad had to sort of stand there and wave a stick at them.
Of course
And we got away, but Suzanne was like having a bit of a sweat on
And you could have got killed
Saying, we could have got killed.
Sure.
And my dad saying "No, it never happens" I just wondered if it does. If there's a risk of...
Yeah, it is rare, but there's been a couple of cases of being trampled. They're not aggressive, they sort of run through you. Well, they're aggressive if they've got a calf.
They had kids.
What?
They had kids with them
Kids, yeah?
Yeah, that's goats your thinking of.

Maybe they were trying to sneak into the gnome thing! And they were worried that, like, if too many people did it.. They thought we're cows we can just sneak in. No one's expecting cows are going to walk in.
The cows were going: (in an funny voice) "Walk upright like you're a human. Walk upright."
They thought you'd blown their cover.
Yeah. People have been killed by cows before.
That was like the highlight.
So when you arrived there, you presumably covered in mud, looking like someone that just come from Glastonbury, staggering around this exhibition.
No, it wasn't that bad. It was just like a woods, and it had like a funny sort of funeral-, like a graveyard thing
Right.
With bodies sort of hanging out the ground and that.
What?!
And they had these six foot gnomes. And then we just set off again, walk back.
Are you sure this wasn't a dream?

No, it was good. It was good. But then I got back, right, Steve? And called up Ricky, I said "Right, you're about?" have a chat on that. So he said, oh just come round it's a nice day. Have a drink and what have you. So I got round there at about 06:30, right? Go up to his door, knock on his door, right? He stood there with his tackle out.
Ahh
Ricky giggles
Yeah. What what did you make of that? What was wrong with that?
What do you mean what's wrong with that?
Why were you look at it? Why were you looking at it?
I tried not to look at it, but again, you're always sort of attracted to it.
Ricky laughs
I've never been attracted to another man's tackle! I don't know what you mean.
He can't help but have a have a little sly look. Especially when it's there. When you when you ring the bell -and I mean the one on the door, right?- and that's hanging out...
And does he dress to the left or the right?
It was to the left, right?
It was to left, yeah. Just popped out of my shorts. Just popped him out of the shorts
Should have seen the state of him! Shorts on, no top. And a cigar. Like someone out of The Sopranos.
It was a mess!
We sat on the balcony drinking wine, didn't we?
Did you pop it back in or...?
Yeah, I popped it straight back in, I've got the laugh.
Sure.
I've got the laugh I wanted. He walked in and he went: "Oh, it's not that hot." Straightaway. "It's not that hot". Ah, Brilliant.
Was that Knob News or is there more?
No, we've got more Knob News.
That's just a taster
Just a taster.
Listen, let's play some adverts, let's play some great music. And maybe we should have some early Knob News.
Early Knob News, coming up.
XFM jingle
'Landed' by Ben Folds on XFM. I'm Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant Karl Pilkington
We had a couple of emails, Rick, saying that there have been reports of people actually being killed by cows
Yeah.
So it is actually quite a lucky escape for Karl and his family.
The worrying thing about that, is it's tragic and anyone dying unexpectedly, it's terrible. But what makes it worse is someone like being killed by cows, because it's a slight... humor aspect.
Yeah
How was he killed? Killed by a cow. Like, for example, if you were killed by a falling safe, the vicar might laugh.
Yes
That's my worry.

Yeah. Well, I read a story in the paper of a man who fell out of a window and died. He fell out of, like, a third story window and he fell out. But it was slightly amusing, because at the time he was mooning.
I know
For a laugh, he was mooning someone and he fell out. So when he fell, even though it was tragic, he obviously had his treasures around his ankles and his arse out.
I know the there was a thing about a kid who died got hit by a truck mooning. But they had the worst thing like that is: it's not funny enough to be killed for.
No
Mooning isn't funny enough.
No. It's just not a good enough gag.
Do you know what I mean? It's a witless sort of thing to do and then to be killed for it.
If you just done a two hour impromptu Eddie Izard-style routine and then you got tragically killed, that would sort of make sense.
I know
But mooning, it's almost karmic because it's such a bad joke.
Yeah, exactly
Some weird universal karmic way. It's like, if you hadn't been mooning, maybe you wouldn't got killed.
I know.
If you haven't done such a lame joke, maybe you'd be okay.
Yeah, that's it.
But yeah, you don't want to be walking along-- You're only walking through the garden and stand on a rake and it flips up
And hits you so hard
And it's like a boing noise.
And it hits you so hard that it kills you.
Or you fall out of a window and a cactus goes up your bum.
Killed by cactus up the arse. Or you're at a concert and a fat woman stage dives.
Yeah.
And she just squashes you. How did he die? He was squashed by a big hefty.
Mama Cass just jumped on him.
Just big fat woman squashed him to death.
Yeah.
Tell you what though. I heard something about fat women.
Go on
And I'm not having a go! Did you see Michelle McManus on..
Oh man alive!
Yeah?
"You are what you eat"? What has she eaten?! Girls Aloud?
Ricky laughs
It was unbelievable!
No, but to be fair, you know she did--
Have you seen her in bikini one?
Well yes, but she was always a little bit...
What do you mean "a little bit"?!
Well, no, she used to eat too much right? But what I did like about it was that she had a go, you know. She did lose--
She tried hard enough, yeah. I quite liked her by the end of it.
Yeah.

She's not an unpleasant woman. She's a lovely woman. But I mean, like I said before, it was that interviewing Heat magazine where I tend to eat eleven packets of Doritos a night. 11 packets! I mean come on, Michelle!
Yeah, that's too much, in it?
Unless you're trying to win some kind of competition, like trying to find some kind of, you know, a golden ticket in one of the packets, there's no excuse!
What could you possibly be trying to win to eat those every day?
Well, it wasn't her who annoys me. It's that doctor in it, that woman. She does me head in
Yeah.
Can't be doing with the way .
She's not actually officially a doctor, isn't she?
No
And her bedside manner is not very good either. The fear tactic that
And what does she look like?!
I mean, she doesn't look like the, sort of peak of health
No, I know
She's sort of like, a witch-like crone-type.
And it can't be good for you, hanging about all that poo all the time. She's always
Ricky & Steve laugh

I've been told not to mess with dog poo, because it can make you blind and she's constantly at it. Rummaging through it, and it annoys me the way it's like "Well, let's have a look at your poo. Let's see if you're eating the wrong types of food." The person is about 33 stone!
Yeah.
It's obvious.
Do you know what I mean? Don't need to look at that. It's just wind-- And I'll tell you the thing that-- I mean, I've never had it done anyway, right? But the... the colonic thing
Did Michelle have that?
Yeah
Yeah, and they've shown it. She sat there, sort of lying down. She's like "Oh"... But I don't understand why people have that done anyway. Unless you are sort of bummed up.
Yeah, or you've got cactus up there.
Yeah.
But the other thing is like the way... like it's a clear tube. Why do you need to... why do you need to see what's whizzing past? Know what I mean? It's like some sort of Generation Game.
Yeah. You gotta remember everything, then you win a prize.
Why can't they just look at it in the bucket after and go "Right, yeah"
But why do you need to look at it at all?
Well, it's
Out of interest init?
See what's come out.
So you go "So that's where that went! I've been looking for that!" A remote control.
How does it work? I don't want to go into graphic detail, but they just send water up there?
No, caffeine.
Caffeine?
Yeah. It's like a big... Like a gallon of coffee. It goes up there and it wants to come out immediately obviously. And... it percolates (giggles)
But when did that happen? How did someone
No one sort of go "tell you what you want to do"
I think it was first invented on Distraction. To win a car. (giggles) I don't know, do I? I suppose they just thought there's stuff up there that's not coming out, let's you know
The coffee's still here though, innit?
They, did that thing, where they find things up there that they swallowed when they were five and that, don't they?
Lego bricks and stuff.

Exactly, yeah. Marbles. But I mean, meats and things can stay in there- You know, it gets it gets caught in a little, you know, a little recess in your in your 30 foot of tubing and it doesn't come out.
Talking of meats, I saw an advert on the way in today, a question to both of you: Who eats Peperami?
I don't know.
Have you ever eaten a Peperami?
It's disgusting!
I've never seen anyone eating a Peperami, buying one... I've never heard anyone say "Ah, delicious Peperami!" earlier. I don't associate it, with anyone, I've never seen anyone eat one.
But when you think, what is it- It's just sort of like... curdled, salt, salty- It's sort of like "Do you want to try a big long blood bogey?"
Yeah
"Uhh, I won't, no!" "It lasts forever." "That's scary, then."
Yeah
You can just keep it-- Keep it under your couch, just as nice in a years time.

Yeah, you-- we were talking briefly earlier about something that you'd been reading.
Well, it's just that you're always having to go at me saying you're never happy
True
You know, what cheers you up? What's the best thing that can happen for you? And stuff like that, right?
(laughs) Sorry, I have never said to you, "what's the best thing that can happen for you?"
No no, but
I'm trying to encourage you

Steve's alw-- Yeah, and you have a bit. I've started reading more and doing more science stuff, even though some of it does me head in, like I say, knowledge is almost annoying. Knowing about that mammoth--
Think about that being a quote! that .
'If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants', 'We will fight them on the beaches!', 'E=MC2', 'Knowledge is annoying'.
Yeah.
That's an amazing one. Karl Pilkington 2005.
No, but it can get you down, can't it? Knowing stuff that's going on.
Yeah, knowing stuff. Sometimes I don't want to have stuff in my head, when I read a horrible story or someone tells me I wish I didn't know it. Yeah.

That's all I'm saying. But at the same time, there was something in the paper about things to do before you die. And it was just stuff that I sort of looked at, I thought, I don't want to do that. Cross that off. Not bothering with that. At number one, you always know what's at number one. It's the same thing every time.
Swimming with dolphins.
Don't know why. Do you want to do that?
What's going on down there that it's so good? What do we not know about?
I mean yeah, I'd be fun, I'd love to sort of encounter most animals, to be honest. I mean, there'd be a few animals on the top of the list. I'd rather hang out with a bunch of chimps.
I wonder if you're down there with dolphins and you're swimming with them and they they sort of they click away. Click-click-click
And they tell you a secret.
Then you go into-- Like they lead you to a cave, right? But down there, it's like being at, like, the Rolling Stones house in the 1970s.
They're smoking
There's drinks, there's women, there's bars
They're eating tuna, they're loving tuna
But they can speak, they're like "all this clicking stuff, it's nonsense. We're in a wild time, they're going to go berserk go crazy. It's 24 hours of nonstop debauchery.
I think it's spiritual
But never mention it to anyone.
It to anyone else.
It's incredible because you know, they're so intelligent and... you know. Do you know about dolphins, how intelligent they are?

Well, people keep saying that, but what have they done? You know what I mean? Why-- What's something that they've done someone done... You know, I've never read a book by a dolphin or whatever. What what have they done, that makes them so bright? It's the same way they go, you know, they look after you, they'll save you and that. There's got to be one baddie in that bunch.
Of course they-- Sorry! I wasn't suggesting they're all Flipper. I'm not suggesting they're constantly going around the oceans trying to save people. I mean, they're intelligent, you know.
In what way?
What do you mean, in what way? Because they pass tests--
Why do people keep saying they're bright?
Because of the things they can achieve and learn.
Like what?
Well, they can tell shapes, objects, colors.
Hmmm..

Sorry, Karl! I mean, they're no match for you! They're not as clever as you. They're way dumber than us and that-- But it's all relative, isn't it? For a non human, they're doing okay. They're up there with chimps, you know.
So what do you want to do before you die?
Anything? Any achievements you want to have?
Well, if I'm ill, I'd prefer to go to the doctors than to go with the dolphins.
Yeah
Why are you suddenly ill? When they say things 'to do before you die', they don't literally mean the sort of the day before... you're croaking!
You want to experience life. You can do it over the next 20 years.
Is that what you thought it meant? Like, literally the 24 hours before you die?

Is that what you meant? Like a priest there going... (speaks while breathing heavily) "Ah, give me the list!" "What is it granddad?" "Dolphins!" "You're in no fit state granddad" "Get me in the water! Get me down to Brighton!" What do you think that list means?!
Well...Yeah, that, you know before you die
You're incredible, Karl!
Amazing!
All this time
Things to do before you die
That's why he doesn't want to do any of them!
Didn't you think it was a bit extraordinary, that you had to swim with dolphins and visit Disneyland and climb Mt. Kilimanjaro, all in the same afternoon?
That's why I said to you! I would be in no mood for a dip.
Ricky laughs
That's incredible!
Always a new twist on things! Always a new twist on things.
But you say about traveling and that... you like traveling and stuff. But what-- Why?

Because I've seen and experienced extraordinary things. You know, I went to Kenya once, I met a man who was a vigilante, he was cleaning up his neighborhood because the police were too corrupt to do it. Carried a sword. And he was extraordinary. He'd been attacked but he didn't care, he fought them off. He was trying in this little slum area to try and instill some law and order. He had to arrest his brother in law once. It was a fascinating story, and he was an extraordinary man!
I went to Manchester and I saw two lads with big heads and web feet looking at a house, there was a horse in the living room! I mean...
That's living.
Leave it, leave it then. Listen, I didn't realize it's like seven minutes to.
Well, come on then!
Well, let's do Rockbusters, alright?
Yeah, do Rockbusters, and you got Monkey News!
We'll see if we got time.
No, we got to do Monkey News!
Listen, listen though! Justin, if he's out--
Oh just quick-- Do the Rockbusters answers then!
Listen, right. Have you got a winner?
No, I don't even know the answers, do I?!
Well, we'll pick one then. Alright. The first one:
Ah, it's chaos...
Steve in the background: I just dropped a plastic cup!
The first one was: When I'm ill, I throw up horse food. That's the clue, the initials were I-H.
I got this one. I must say

That was "I sick hays". Because when you're ill, you're sick. What do horses eat? They eat hay. "I sick hays" is the answer. You got that. Second one: That garden tool-- That garden tool you've got, it's not yours, what you're doing with it? Right? N-D
That was different.

That was a-- What's a garden tool? A rake. If it's not yours, what you've done? You've nicked it. You've nicked-- Nicked rake. You've nicked that rake. Nicked rake. Nick Drake. So that's N-D. So you go that...
I don't know where to sta--
That's fine! That's fine, Rick!
The third one: That male sheep sounds well fed up.
Go on
What's up with it? That was T-R. That was... that was... That ram-- Ram-- Ram is a male sheep. It's fed up. It's moaning. Ram moans. Ramones. The Ramones. So they got that as well.
Let's give it to Jenny Mckeen from Isle of Wight, because she's got all three of those answers, and--
Right straight onto Monkey News.
No, let's play a record, play a record--
No! We've got to do Monkey News! It's only five minutes to go!
We've got time for a record then some Monkey News, surely.
Yeah
Ahh...
A bit of XTC
Song fades in
'Making Plans For Nigel' - XTC. Okay, let's play the jingle!
Oh, Chimpanzee that, Monkey News!
Right. This happened in Pittsburgh.
Alright

There's a rock band. And they've got this studio in Pittsburgh and what have you. And the lane down tracks and stuff like that. And in the studio that they use, there's this-- This monkey works there.
Steve laughs
I love the fact that he throws that in. Like-- He throws that in, this monkey works there.
No, it's just got a little gig there, he sort of carries the equipment in, guitars, all that
No he doesn't!
He does.
No, he doesn't!
He sort of cleans up after the bands, all that
No, he doesn't!
Emptying the ashtrays.
Doesn't happen!
That sort of stuff. That's the gig it's got. Anyway, right?
Gets women out of the crowd that they want to... go berserk with
With one arm!
Steve's making monkey noises
So anyway, right? So the band's in the studio. And one of the band members brings some A&R fella to the studio to have a listen to the latest track.
Yeah
So they hit play and they're all there going "Hmmm yeah, brilliant. This is good."
(laughs slightly) Oh no!
Anyway, so the fella says "Yeah, I like the track, especially, like, the bass on it", right?
Right, this is bullshit!
So...
This is rubbish!
And they laid down a bass with him?
So, so--
Have you heard it?
Ahh Karl! Please don't do this to me!
So the A&R fella goes, and it's like-- The band members have stood about and they go "Oh that's good, that he liked it" And they're saying "Yeah, but what's going on about with the bass?"
NO!
This is rubbish! This is absolute rubbish. Where'd you get this from?
Let's just hear it, please?
Because we never get to the end. Let's hear it.
This is absolute nonsense!
So they played it back...
Yeah, and it's the chimp playing bass. Definitely not!
So they were like "That's weird. We haven't got a bassist" Anyway. So they go "Whatever", rights?
"We haven't got a bassist!"
They go "Whatever, let's go home!"
Ahh, forget it!
Ricky laughs
XFM jingle

trivia.description: Mini Babybel is a brand of small snack cheese products that are individually packaged and available in various flavours.
Girls Aloud were an English-Irish pop girl group that was created through the ITV talent show Popstars: The Rivals in 2002
The Generation Game was a British game show on BBC, where the victorious team watched prizes pass on a conveyor belt, and won as many as they could recall in 45 seconds.

Distraction is a game show that aired on Channel 4 in the United Kingdom from 31 October 2003 to 11 June 2004. Presented by comedian Jimmy Carr, the show involved contestants answering questions while being distracted in various bizarre, painful and humiliating ways.

Peperami is a pork jerky snack manufactured by Jack Link's. It is similar to BiFi and is manufactured in Ansbach, Germany, and sold in the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland, across multiples and independent retailers.
Carlsberg Special Brew is a super strong lager, also known as ‘tramp juice.’
Battersea Dogs Home is one of the UK's oldest and best known animal rescue centres
Andy Kane, nicknamed "Handy Andy", is an English television personality best known for his work on the BBC's DIY programme Changing Rooms.

'Dick Whittington and His Cat' is the English folklore surrounding the real-life Richard Whittington (c. 1354–1423), wealthy merchant and later Lord Mayor of London. The legend describes his rise from poverty-stricken childhood with the fortune he made through the sale of his cat to a rat-infested country.

Artists and repertoire (A&R) is the division of a record label or music publishing company that is responsible for talent scouting and overseeing the artistic development of recording artists and songwriters.
